text: DAVID NORRIS, 33, is having a private moment, looking dow thinking. He wears a suit and tie. He seems relaxed and confident. Content. Completely in his element. In one of his hands he's absentmindedly twirling a couple individually-wrapped Ricola throat lozenges. We hear the muffled voice of someone on a PA system outside:
Thank you so much for coming today-- A man in a BLUE BLAZER walks up to David.
Congressman Norris-? Now REVEAL that we're Afl: the entry hall of the Admin Bu at St. Johns University. A thousand people crowd the quad out front. "Norris for Senate" placards everywhere.
Fred O'Malley with the DNC. I've never seen a crowd this big turn out so early in the cycle. CHARLIE TRAYNOR, 36, arrives--.
Just wait 'till you see how they respond to him.. David pops a cherry lozenge into his mouth and straighten his lapel pin, which is shaped like New York State.
Don't build me up like that, Charlie. He'll be disappointed.
The crowd, many of them in their twenties, roars with approval as David walks out to the lectern on the steps o the Admin Building.
Hi there. I'm David Norris. And I'm running for the US Senate. 2/12/09 2. The crowd goes wild.

--David finishes a speech at the FDNY Academy's graduatio The cadets jump to their feet and give him a standing ovation. --David shakes the hands of workers entering a .Con Ediso plant in Buffalo. He's a natural at this. Unlike most politicians he actually seems to enjoy campaigning. --Flashbulbs go off as he plays a game of pick-up basketb with a group of Bronx teenagers. Charlie is nearby. --David takes a ceremonial shovel full of dirt to begin redevelopment of an old military base upstate. --He gives a speech at a Harlem church. Audiences watch David the way they watched JFK, the way they watch Obama today. He inspires, makes them believe, makes them want t follow him. Especially young people. --David walks through a suburban mall happily shaking han as cameras follow him and citizens snap pictures with the camera-phones. People crush around him. He:doesn't seem t mind at all. He welcomes it. He feeds off it. --He pops a cherry lozenge in his mouth and climbs up ont tractor to speak to a gathering of upstate farmers, speak into a bullhorn to compensate for his hoarse voice. Charl stands nearby watching him speak:.

David enters his hotel room. The silence contrasts starkl with the noisy energy of the campaign trail. He turns on the TV. Scrolls through the channels. After a moment shuts it off. Total silence again. It bothers him. He opens up his briefcase. Pulls out a thick file -- his itinerary for the next three days. Dozens of speeches and meetings across the state. He glances at the summary page on the top. Glances down t page with his finger, stopping, almost at random, on a sp he's giving two days from now at the Westchester County O Space Initiative.
Karen Woods, founder. Husband: Bob. 2/12/09 3.

Kids: Samantha, painting, and Ricky, Little League. John Pascal. Wife: Anna. St. John's grad. Two year old: Loyita... He stops. Knows this cold. His finger runs down to a Realtor's Association breakfast in Nassau County four day out.

Abagail "Abby" Best, Stuart Broxterman, Chapel Davis, Milan Sabovic, Jim Vargas... His ability to retain this sort of information is stunnin He doesn't need to review. It's already all there. He closes his itinerary file. Goes to the window and look out at the trees. The silence back...it's deafening.

Charlie enters the lobby. Stops suddenly: spots David, holding court at`the hotel bar. Fifteen strangers around as he regales them with a story, despite the fact that he clearly losing his voice. Charlie walks over, pulls him aside.

What the hell? What happened to "I'm going to have softie tea, rest my voice, and go to bed early?" You have Diane Sawyer tomorrow and you have to be up at four AM for us to make it in time. David is holding ,a beer, in his left hand. With his free he picks up a cup and saucer.
I had some tea. (sees Charlie's not in the

Come on, man. We're eight points up in the polls. I've gotta cut loose every once in a while and have a life. This provokes a quizzical look from Charlie. Fifteen strangers in a crappy upstate Sheraton doesn't seem like having a life to him... 2/12/09 4.
Ten.
What?
Latest poll has you ten points up. A slow smile spreads across David's face.
The sound of a busy room. Then one voice, much louder: CAMPAIGN AIDE. County reporting: 8901 for Lynfield, 7233 for Norris.
Charlie Traynor walks over to the aide who just shouted t She's writing vote totals onto a map of New York by count
Better than I thought, I thought we'd get killed in Seneca. He turns to look at a large suite full of more than a doz Norris supporters talking on phones and typing into lapto
Eddie, call Boyd! Where the hell are the. Suffolk numbers? We've got to get the Suffolk numbers!

A light snow falls. Four MEN IN CONSERVATIVE SUITS, overcoats, and fedoras walk across the roof of a forty-st building. Their clothing is more timeless than old- fashioned. And somehow so is their demeanor. The men get to the edge and look down over the city, almo as if it's their domain. 2/12/09 5.
David watches the election coverage on TV. Pundits are discussing the New York Senate race, which CNN has alread called for David's opponent.

Congressman Norris has a reputation for being very direct, even blunt, in his campaign speeches, which is great until you say too many things you wish you hadn't. Then you start to look like an amateur.

That's bad for any candidate but it's fatal if you're running for Senate at the age of 33, your opponent keeps calling you an "impulsive kid," and you almost killed your entire political career five months ago with an act of immaturity that ended up on the front page of`.the New York Post. David winces slightly. This is excruciating. Just then Charlie enters.. The nerve center.suite is visible throug the open door behind him.
Why are you still watching CNN? They called this way too early. David doesn't share his friend's optimism.
A' campaign aide with a phone to her ear shouts to the ro
Suffolk County Numbers! Charlie and David emerge from the private room to listen.
Lynfield: 415,120. Norris: 370,233. Charlie's energy and optimism disappear instantly.
(after long beat) I really thought we'd win Suffolk. 2/12/09 6. A senior aide walks over.
Kings County just came in too.
He shows a piece of paper to Charlie and David. beat...

Well, it's over. And it's going to be a blowout... David puts on a brave face. . .but this is the first mome that he realizes not only is he going to lose, but he's g to lose big. It's going to be a grand,. public humiliatio
NBC has us up next. Charlie takes a clicker and turns the closest TV to NBC.

Turning now to the New York Senate race, NBC is now calling the election for Roger'Lynfield. After a shockingly poor showing in both Suffolk county and in his home county, Kings, it now appears that David Norris will lose this election badly, perhaps by as much as 10 points.
The four men in dark suits.. The boss's name is RICHARDSO early 40s. His top aide is.AHARRY, 50s.
This is a.bignight, gentleman.
Is ever ything set? Harry nods. Richardson notices his eyes:
You look tired. You should take a vacation when we finish with this. You'll have earned it.
I'm not sure the kind of tired I feel would be fixed by a vacation. 2/12/09 7.
Sure it would. Everybody needs a vacation. Even us.
The staff and supporters in here have become very quiet. Their candidate is standing in the middle of the room, bu one can look at him. And David can't look at them either.
I'm going to take a walk, figure out my speech.
Four-hundred campaign workers follow election news on big screens in the Waldorf's Grand Ballroom. No one says a wo The mood has gone from.hopeful to funereal in sixty secon

David slips through the lobby with only a few looks from staff. But when he.gets to the door he sees that press va line the front of the hotel. There will be no peace for h if he steps out there. He turns around.
Good evening, Congressman. You're in the Grand Ballroom if that's what you're looking for.
Actually just looking for a place to be alone for a minute before I head in there.
None of the banquet rooms on the third floor are in use tonight.
Thank you.
David stands alone looking out at the empty room. Trying get used to it. It's not easy. 2/12/09 8.

David enters the huge, ornate, men's room and goes to the of sinks. He pulls two Ricola cherry lozenges from his pocket. He twirls them in his hands for a moment. Then tosses them into the trash can. He looks at himself the mirror, fighting to hold himself together. A sound behind him. David spins to see a WOMAN exiting on of the stalls. She's in a stunning ball gown and carrying expensive bottle of champagne.
Hi. I hope I didn't startle you.
What are you doing in here?
Hiding from security.
Oh... . What did you do?
Crashed a wedding. One floor up.
It's almost midnight. They'just caught on now?
Ivana Trump finally realized I wasn't her niece. I think after the fifth; glass of champagne my Czech accent started slipping. spite of David's state that gets a grin.
Are you for real?
Life is short.
Hard to argue with that.
You're that guy running for Senate aren't you?
I'm "that guy." 2/12/09 9.
You winning?
No.
Too bad. The other guy's a tool.
Maybe I should have made that clearer in my ads.
Personally, I think mooning your friends at a college reunion is no big deal.
And I don't think the Post should have printed the photo. David just shakes his head. He will never, ever live that down and he knows it.
At least not full page. He can't help but crack up.
Listen, I've done it.
You weren't running, for Senate at the time.
Do you still have a chance or is it over?
He crushed me. She has beautiful eyes. And an exceptional gift for conveying empathy...
You must ...I don't know what you must be feeling...
Winning would feel better. But losing has its advantages. 2/12/09 10.
Like what?
The only time a politician is alone is when he's asleep.. .or in the bathroom. After eight years in politics that gets kind of hard to take. She tilts her head a little, gives him a curious look.
Watching you, you'd never know it. The way she looks at him, the way she says it, David know she sees what others miss in him -- even if he isn't even quite sure what it is. Not yet.
Thank you...
Well, everything happens for a reason, right? Even losing. God, I'm really rollrng out the platitudes tonight, aren't I?
It's the champagne. Brines out the Hallmark in people.
After it kills their Czech accents. She offers:him the bottle. He hesitates, then takes it.
Why not? I have to think up some good platitudes for my speech. He takes a gulp of champagne.
Why the hell would you do that?
Apparently, even if I hadn't been caught dropping my drawers in the middle of a senate campaign I would have lost the election anyway because I'm too blunt.
(swig of champagne) Says who? 2/12/09 11.
The TV pundits.
Fuck 'em. They just wish they had the balls to be candidates themselves. She hands him the champagne bottle again.
And they work for the Man anyway.
You going to run again?
Tonight's probably not the night to ask.
No, it is. Look at me. You have to run again. Do-yo hear me? She's serious about this. Intense.
Otherwise the-country will be run by tools. like Lynwood.
"Field." (of f her look) "Lynfield." A beat. She shrugs. Then they lean toward each other... and kiss. It turns mo and more passionate. When they finally pull apart:
Holy shit. She seems just as surprised. They look at each other and laugh. Just then the bathroom door opens. It's Charlie. He sees David and the woman.
David?
I better go. 2/12/09 12. She exits.
The woman comes out of the bathroom. David is right behin her. Then Charlie.
Wait. The woman turns to face David. Suddenly two hotel guards turn the corner and spot the woman.
There! They rush toward her.
Gotta go. (to David, emphatically.) Don't let the bastards grind you down. She spins and sprints away. The hotel guards chase her.
What the hell was that?
I'm really not sure. David has a huge grin on his face.
But I think I'm ready to give my speech.
David as he walks out from behind a curtain onto the dais His supporters start clapping... . but clearly they're heartbroken. David looks completely peaceful.
I grew up in Red Hook and I don't want to shock anybody but I got in a few fist fights along the way. Laughter ripples through the crowd. We don't know enough to get the joke. 2/12/09 13.
And we used to have a saying when you got in a fight: "it's not whether or not you get knocked down -- because eventually everyone does -- it's what you do when you get back up."
Don't worry, I'm not going to moon you. The audience explodes with laughter this time.

But I am... (waiting for the laughter to die down) But I am going to get backup. I wanted to come out here tonight and give you a victory speech, a speech I've dreamed of giving foremost of my life. But life doesn't always deal you the cards you want. The audience sobered now. Reflective.
My life changed when I was ten years old. My entire world turned upside-down.' His audience,. knows exactly what he's talking about.

And as I looked for something to -hang ;on to, something; to help me cope' with what had. happened the only thing that made sense to me was service. Finding a way to do something with my life that left this world a little better than I found it. The audience is moved. Tears begin to well up. People dab at their eyes.

The sky is just beginning to turn from black to deep blue The park is still and silent. A black Mercedes pulls up on Madison Ave. Mr. Richardson, again in a dark suit, gets out and enters the park. 2/12/09 14.
Harry sits on one of the benches -- a fedora in his lap t complement a gray flannel suit. Richardson arrives.
He spills his coffee when he steps out of Starbucks. The moment he comes through the door.
Got it.
Our models indicate between 7:00 and 7:05 am. Harry nods but he seems distant Richardson sees this.
You planned that vacation, right?
Two weeks. Richardson claps him din-the shoulder and leaves. Harry watches him go.

An alarm clock reads "5:44 airy." It turns to "5:45" and alarm goes off. A hand reaches over and taps the alarm of FOLLOW the arm back to David Norris in a king-sized bed. rubs his eyes, stretches his neck, and climbs out of bed.
David works out. He's got the-energy-level of a 25 year-o He runs on a treadmill. Hits the heavy bag. Does sit-ups.
EXAMINE David's spacious one-bedroom overlooking Madison Square Park. His desk and dining room table is covered wi stacks of paper and files. A flat screen displays CNBC:
RSR Capital announced yesterday that David Norris would become its Vice Chairman. 2/12/09 15.
David shaves.
Norris worked at Goldman Sachs for four years before running for Congress at the tender age of 25.
A desk is set up at one end of the living room. A new mod blackberry on the desk next to another cell phone.
He served four terms in the House-- The blackberry rings.
--prior to his unsuccessful bid for Senate in last week's election. David rushes over and ?icks=up the blackberry. He has to look for a second to figure out how to hit "answer."
RSR, one ofthe country's fastest- growing hedge funds is run by NO ris's former Goldman colleague and campaign chairman, Charles
The blackberry rings again. It's very loud.
. his . electrifying concession speech led commentators to-- Finally David finds the answer button as he mutes the TV.
Hello?
Tom Frankel from the Journal is calling you in five minutes. I just gave him this number.
Give him 3227. I'm not used to this phone yet. 2/12/09 16.
Can't. He's going to ask you about joining the firm. My compliance guys say all firm business has to be done on the blackberry.
Really?
Sarbanes-Oxley. You voted for it, pal. In fact, you cosponsored it.
Through the window we see David getting his morning coffe He exits and LEAVES FRAME. HOLD on the door of Starbucks.
Harry is snoring on his bench. David walks past.
David arrives at Fifth just in time to catch the "M1 Limi Stop" bus arriving`at the stop.

Sunlightpeeks:.through a gap in the buildings and falls o Harry's left eye, waking him. He bolts upright. Checks hi watch, Shit! He looks around quickly. Spots David about t get o n the bus. Harry leaps : up--
.As David pays, he notices Harry sprinting for the bus.
Sir, there's someone--
There's another M1 right behind me.
The bus pulls out. Harry keeps running after it. 2/12/09 17.
No...

As David walks down the aisle a couple of passengers recognize his face. . .but they don't say anything. David nears an empty aisle seat. A woman is curled up in window seat, sleeping. She wears a funky mini-dress, knee high argyle socks under leather boots, and a (clashing) argyle bucket cap. David sits next to her. And stares.

No way... It's the woman from election night.', He leans around to to see the front of her face. "It's definitely her. His eyes drift down at her legs. Just then she opens her eyes She recoils for a second;. Then` her eyes soften when she realizes who it is.
I think. we "ve met.
You need a better line than that or I'll have to assume you're a pervert who likes to stare at girls' legs while-, they sleep.
(smiles, game on) Your skirt was so short I couldn't help it.
Dress.
Skirt, dress, same thing.
If you're a pervert, yeah. All that matters is they both show leg.
So do shorts, dear. 2/12/09 18.
Yeah, but there's that pesky piece of fabric right here that interferes with your fantasy life. She shuts her eyes and leans against the window.
Wake me when you have a good come back to that.
I have one but, unlike you, I wouldn't say it in public.
(eyes still closed) Pussy. David laughs. Can not believe this woman. In a good way. His blackberry RINGS. Her eyes pop open. David.picks up.
Hello...? Hello? David looks at his. phone. The signal has gone to zero.
The line cut.
That ringer get any-louder or do you pretty much have it maxed out?
You're relentless.
I never sleep through the night. I catch up on the bus.
You going to run again?
I just started a new job, today.
I saw your concession speech. I heard Bill Clinton called it the best political speech he's seen in 20 years. David looks back at her. 2/12/09 19.
Something got into me. He means her. They stare at each other.
What's the deal with you and argyles?
What's the deal with you and boring shades of blue? David is wearing a Navy blue suit, blue shirt, and blue t A beat.
At least my clothes match.
That's easy if you. restrict yourself to one color.
The belt and shoes are black.
Variety is the spice of .life .
There you` go with the platitudes again. I guess it wasn't the ch mpagne . His blackberry goes again. RING-RING.
Hello? Hello? He shakes his head. It's dead again.
Harry runs down Broadway looking east on 19th to try to s the bus on Park.
Your phone sucks. Don't guys like you get special phones that actually work in the middle of the biggest city in the country? 2/12/09 20.
Depends what the telecom lobby thinks of your voting record.
Harry spots the bus passing on Park. He jams his fedora o his head and stretches his arm out--
Now.
David's phone rings again. As he reaches for the phone he fumbles his coffee cup, the lid comes off, and a slosh of coffee crests the brim and splashes on the woman's dress.
Oh, Jesus...
I'm sorry.
Harry's face.

Shit! He's looking at a leather portfolio. We catch a glimpse inside: a complicated circuit diagram. Harry shuts the book, look's up to get a bead on" the the bus, then takes Broadway, again, hoping to cut it off at Union Square.
I'll pay for the damage. He pulls out his wallet. There's $7 inside. She laughs.
Hope your new job pays better than your old one.
Give me your number and I'll send you a check. 2/12/09 21.
God, that is smooth. Spill coffee on me then ask for my number. She takes the coffee from his hands and casually takes a then turns back to him with a devilish look in her eyes.
Just let me spill some on you and we'll be even. She thrusts the cup toward his tie. David parries.
It's my first day at the office!
Tell your boss some crazy chick dumped coffee on you on the MI. It's New York; he'll understand. She thrusts the cup back at him-
No! He grabs the cup with both his hands over hers.
Come on. Just a little. They struggle with the cup.                          DAVI You're crazy. Actually crazy. The phone on David's lap'RINGS again. She snatches it wit her free hand.
He's not here! She hangs up.
Who was that? She shrugs. Sorry, pal. He lunges for his phone, but she holds it on the other side of her body.
What is this, third grade? 2/12/09 22.
You forgot what that was like, didn't you? How fun it was... That stops him for a moment. Until the phone RINGS again.
Oh my God! How do you stand it? She drops the phone into the coffee.
There. We're even. He stares at her. Incredulous. They lock eyes. God knows what would come next if they were in private... The fourth RING gurgles up through the coffee. A beat.
Sturdy little fucker, isn't it? She pulls the phone out of the cup and wipes it off with scarf, pushing the button which sends the call to voice m Then she reaches out her hand, as if to shake.
By the way, I'm Elise.
Elise exits.. the bus. David stands at the bus door watch her. She turns back to look at him.
The morning after .I lost I woke up thinking about you . That melts her. Instantly. All her bravado drops.

Moments later. Through the window, David watches Elise walking down the sidewalk. Their eyes meet. She blows him a little kiss before she turns the corner. His heart skip a beat as the bus continues on down Union Square East.
Harry runs through Union Square bee-lining for David's bu 2/12/09 23.
David looks at Elise's number, scribbled on a piece of pa He carefully tucks her number into his wallet. Then takes the most satisfying sip of coffee he's ever had in his li
Spotting David through the bus window, Harry thrusts his Fedora back onto his head and points at the bus--
Just as David finishes his sip the-plastic lid pops off t cup. A second earlier and the coffee would have poured al over his shirt. Instead it spills: on the floor.
Dammit! Harry sprints out onto lark Avenue now, right behind the HONK! Harry turns just in time to see a.taxi skid into hi TRUNK! He rolls up onto the hood--
A big corner office. The phone rings. Charlie picks up.
Guess who I just sat down next to on the bus?
Who?
The woman from election night.
A dazed Harry lies in the road... The taxi driver who hit him jumps out of his car to see if Harry is okay... 2/12/09 24.
The one you kissed?
She kissed me. I just didn't fight it.
Harry sits up... He's bruised but okay. He looks around f something. Spots his crushed hat under the taxi's front tire.
You're shitting me. Just randomly you sit down next to-- He's cut off mid-word.
Charlie? David looks at his phone. "Call Lost" on the screen. Davi hits redial. Gets a fast busy.
' (to himself). This is ridiculous. He pockets his phone.
The taxi driver is with Harry now.
Are you okay? Harry is sitting now, wincing, but still searching intent for something.
I'm fine-- Will you hand me that? Harry points at his leather portfolio on the pavement a f feet away. We'll come to know it as a "PLANBOOK." 2/12/09 25.

Are you sure you're okay? The driver hands it to him. Harry flips to a bookmarked page and we get our first good look at that circuit diagr Thousands of interconnected lines. Dozens of geometric symbols at intersection points. And written notations in language as complex as Sanskrit crossed with Chinese. And, maybe it's just a trick of the light but several of lines appear to re-arrange themselves on the page.
Oh...shit...
David's still grinning as he reaches his downtown office tower. He enters through the revolving door--

location: DAVID'S OFFICE BUILDING'-- GROUND FLOOR LOBBY

text: Empty, except for a bored-looking security guard at the o end of the lobby. David gets into an empty elevator.
David walks past the receptionist She's on the phone. He waves as-he:passes by. No wade back. She must not see him
Okay... Daviddecides he doesn't need to announce himself.
David enters to find the office suite quiet... Not a soul in sight. Not a single secretary is here.

(loud, playful) Doesn't anybody bother getting in before eight at this place? David passes a couple of empty offices on his way towards large corner suite where a secretary sits outside an offi marked "Charles Traynor, Chairman." She's smiling. 2/12/09 26.
Susan! How are you today? (when she doesn't move) Susan? David looks closer across her desk. Her face is frozen.
Susan? He leans across her desk, touches her arm. She stays dead still. David rushes through Charlie's door:
Call 911! Something's wrong with Susan!

--and rushes in to find that Charlie is frozen too -- wit the phone up to his ear. Like he's in a wax museum. He is surrounded by four men in bulky, metallic silver protective suits .(think airport firefighter gear). One of the men adjusts three metal. probes which are atta to the left side.of Charlie's skull.
Jesus! Three men in business suits talking by the window spin to David. it's Mr. Richardson and-two aides we recognize as "security guards" who chased Elise away on election night
What the hell are you doing?! Richardson blinks Clearly surprised. Then:
Grab him! David bolts out of the office as they lunge at him--

David sprints toward the door he came in. It closes as he gets there. He grabs it. It's locked. He sprints away into an internal hallway. Richardson emer from a door in the middle of the hallway. 2/12/09 27. David jumps a mile. It's physically impossible that Richardson could have gotten there that fast.

You can't get away, David. David spins and rushes back into the main office, then do an internal staircase to the floor below. Jumps the last five steps and hits the floor hard. As he comes up he runs smack into another RSR employee wh frozen solid. David curses, then dives around the frozen employee to fi Richardson, coming out of another office. down the hall. Again, physically impossible for him to get there that fa David spins and-- A DISTORTED WIDE ANGLE SHOT of a chloroform rag shoved right at us. FOCUS GOES IN AND OUT. FROM DAVID'S POV, BLURRY FOCUS as he's carried toward one the large corner offices on the 40th floor. The nameplate reads "Steve Kincaid." Richardson opens the door and ushers his men, carrying Da
Except when they walk through the door they're not in an office 40 floors above lower Manhattan,: they step inside large warehouse... Their movement completely violates the laws of physics.
Silence. Then voices come up slowly:
Yes, sir. No, sir. No, sir. I understand that, sir. Absolutely. I'll do that, sir.
What a goddamm mess.
Was that Donaldson?
Yes.

What do you want to do? 2/12/09 28. FADE UP -- BLURRY AT FIRST -- to DAVID'S POV of the wareh David caught a glimpse of just before he passed out. A half-dozen members of the "Intervention Team" (the Silv Suits) stand nearby. Richardson and MCCRADY (one of the m from the rooftops) stand behind David, about 20 feet away
Can you reset him?
I don't think we have the authority in a situation like this.
Legal just arrived.
REVEAL BURDENSKY, a 50 year-old in a pin-stripe suit, carrying a briefcase. He.walks to Richardson.

Re-setting's off the table. This is our fault:... Richardson glances irately at Harry, who stands by himsel off to the side, clearly disgraced. David, who is tied to a chair facing away from Richardson cranes around to see who's talking.
Hey. The suits stare back in silence for a beat, then turn bac talking amongst themselves -- though at a lower volume.
What are my options?
You could bullshit him but you'll never be completely successful.
Can somebody tell me what's going on? 2/12/09 29.
(still ignoring him) The questions will burn in him till the day he dies. You'll have to monitor him constantly...
He can hear little snippets of what Burdensky's saying--
.to make sure he doesn't talk... the endless ripple effects... REVEAL David untying the rope restraining him.
If it were me, I'd level with him.
Completely?
That's the only way to extinguish his curiosity. Richardson turns and studies David. Then walks over to hi An uncomfortable pause.
Who are you guys?

We're the people v ho make sure things happen according to Plan. David stares back at him for a moment. then leaps up. His rope comes off and the chair falls. He sprints toward an open door forty feet across the warehou Richardson makes a little gesture with his hand--
It cracks.. .and displaces upward.. .so it's uneven just David's foot comes down on it. 2/12/09 30.
David trips and goes flying--
David is dragged back to the center of the room and place back in his chair in front of Richardson.
Did you really think I couldn't see that coming? David dabs blood from his lip, which split during the fal
I can read your mind! David stares back.
Yeah, really...
Choose a color. (barely a beat) Blue. Choose a number. (even less time) Seventeen. David's jaw drops slightly. Richardson was clearly right.
Now,. why are you still deciding whether or not to run? David's hands go to his head`, involuntarily, an atavisti response, as if;s.omehow that will keep his thoughts from spilling out into view.

You saw the futility of that back at the office. David's entire reality has finally been bent to the break point. He can't hang on any longer to an explanation for this based in the world he's known to date...
What the hell is happening to me? 2/12/09 31.
You just saw behind a curtain you weren't even supposed to know was there, Mr. Norris. Its jarring. I'm sure.
I just... came to work...

It wasn't your fault. Your Path through the world this morning was supposed to be adjusted. (glancing bitterly at Harry, in the corner) Your coffee was supposed to.spill onto your shirt as you left Starbucks near your apartment. You would have gone up to change and arrived at work ten minutes later than you did. By then we would have left.

People call it "chance" when their coffee spills or their internet goes down or they misplace their keys. Sometimes it is. Sometimes it's:us...nudging you back on Plan. David takes all this in. He's still shell-shocked.
Whatever you were doing to Charlie back there... it wasn't misplacing his keys.
Sometimes. when nudging a person back on Plan isn't enough we intervene directly.
Why Charlie? What did you do to him.
